etymologies: late Middle English: from late Latin valentia ‘power, competence’, from valere ‘be well or strong’

definitions: the combining power of an element, especially as measured by the number of hydrogen atoms it can displace or combine with

examples.text: carbon always has a valence of 4

definitions: relating to or denoting electrons involved in or available for chemical bond formation
shortDefinitions: of electrons involved in or available for chemical bond formation

definitions: the number of grammatical elements with which a particular word, especially a verb, combines in a sentence.
shortDefinitions: number of grammatical elements with which particular word combines in sentence
